author: Anna Cecilia Nunes
title: Vídeo: Mulher sofre mal súbito e morre durante treino em academia na Bahia Mulher morre após passar mal em academia na Bahia. (Foto: Unsplash)
text:
Francineide Pereira Soares, de 43 anos, morreu após sofrer um mal súbito enquanto treinava em uma academia em Santo Estevão, cidade localizada a cerca de 156 km de Salvador, na segunda-feira (17). A mulher utilizava o aparelho conhecido como cadeira extensora quando relatou uma forte dor de cabeça e começou a passar mal.
Câmeras de segurança do local registraram o momento em que Francineide finaliza a série de exercícios, se encosta e desmaia. Nas imagens, é possível ver alunos e um instrutor se aproximando rapidamente para ajudar.
De acordo com o g1, ela recebeu os primeiros atendimentos ainda na academia e foi levada por uma ambulância do Serviço de Atendimento Móvel de Urgência (Samu) ao Hospital Municipal Dr. João Borges de Cerqueira. No entanto, Francineide não resistiu e morreu antes de chegar à unidade de saúde.
A Polícia Civil informou que o caso foi registrado como morte a esclarecer, sem indícios de crime, na Delegacia Territorial de Santo Estevão. A causa do óbito será confirmada através de laudos do Departamento de Polícia Técnica (DPT). A academia lamentou a morte da aluna nas redes sociais e suspendeu suas atividades na terça-feira (18).
Uma mulher de 43 anos morreu enquanto fazia musculação em uma academia localizada em Santo Estêvão, na Bahia. Câmeras de segurança mostram o momento em que a mulher passa mal na cadeira extensora e cai. A Polícia Civil da Bahia está investigando o caso. A vítima morreu antes de…
[pic.twitter.com/x0yhZ55D2H]— O Tempo (@otempo)
[February 20, 2025]
“A unidade policial expediu as guias para remoção e perícia do corpo da mulher, que teve mal súbito quando estava praticando atividade física em academia. Os laudos do Departamento de Polícia Técnica (DPT) devem esclarecer a causa da morte”, explicou a polícia, em nota.
Siga a Hugo Gloss no Google News e acompanhe nossos destaques

author: Universal do Reino do Deus
title: Polícia Militar realizou formatura de centenas de crianças do PROERD, em Palmas (TO)
text:
Polícia Militar realizou formatura de centenas de crianças do PROERD, em Palmas (TO)
A solenidade aconteceu na Catedral da Universal. Saiba como foi
A Polícia Militar do estado do Tocantins, região central do País, realizou na manhã do dia 28 de novembro a formatura de cerca de 790 crianças participantes do Programa Educacional de Resistência às Drogas e à Violência (PROERD), que promove a valorização da vida e a prevenção ao uso de drogas e violência.
O que devemos destacar:
A solenidade da cerimônia aconteceu na Catedral da Universal de Palmas, capital do estado do Tocantins.
Outras informações sobre a solenidade:
- A ação durou cerca de uma hora e meia;
- Mais de 850 pessoas estiveram presentes;
- 12 voluntários do UFP participaram no dia;
- O momento reuniu 24 turmas de alunos da rede pública de ensino atendidas em toda a capital, incluindo o plano diretor, Taquaralto e zona rural;
- O evento contou com a presença de diversas autoridades;
- Entre elas, o Subchefe do Estado Maior da Polícia Militar do Tocantins, Coronel da PM Marizon Mendes Marques e Coordenador Estadual do Proerd, Tenente-Coronel da PM Sandro de Lima Silva;
- Também estiveram presentes secretários da cidade de Palmas e do estado do Tocantins, além de professores, familiares dos alunos e, sobretudo, pastores da Universal.
A Bíblia diz:
“Então os filhos dos profetas que estavam em Jericó se chegaram a Eliseu, e lhe disseram: Sabes que o SENHOR hoje tomará o teu senhor por sobre a tua cabeça? E ele disse: Também eu bem o sei; calai-vos.” 2 Reis 2.5
Durante a solenidade, Pastor Givaldo Carvalho, responsável pelo trabalho evangelístico da Universal em Tocantins, levou uma mensagem importante a todos por meio da passagem bíblica acima, contida em Reis.
Ele disse que quando a pessoa crê e obedece, consequentemente, ela alcança o milagre. Ou seja, basta apenas ela fazer aquilo que a Palavra de Deus diz.
O que disseram as autoridades presentes:
Na oportunidade, o Coronel da PM Marques destacou a importância do momento e também aproveitou para agradecer a parceria com as escolas, famílias e demais instituições, como a Universal, que cedeu espaço para a realização da formatura.
Fora isso, ele salientou sobre a implementação das ações do programa, que é a principal frente de serviço da Polícia Militar com o trabalho preventivo e educativo com relação às drogas e à violência.
Ademais, o Tenente-Coronel da PM Lima também reforçou com todos os presentes que um evento grandioso como a formatura requer união de esforços e que, por isso, todo o apoio da Igreja foi fundamental, da mesma forma como todo o trabalho evangelístico que é realizado, fortalecendo as famílias e preparando-as para lidarem com situações difíceis, como a questão das drogas e de atos de violência.
Leia também:
“Concentração de Fé e Milagres” acontece em Divinópolis (TO)
Inaugurado o novo templo da Universal, em Palmas (TO)

(*) Com informações da Universal em Palmas (TO)

author: Anonym
title: Israeli soldier and security guard injured in stabbing attack in southern Jerusalem - Teller Report
text: Israeli forces opened fire on the perpetrator of the stabbing attack, killing him (social media) A Border Police soldier and an Israeli security guard were seriously to moderately injured in a stabbing attack at the Mazmoriya checkpoint, south of occupied Jerusalem. The Israeli police said that the perpetrator of the attack arrived in his car at the checkpoint and got out of it, where he stabbed the soldier first and then the security guard, before the soldiers shot him. Al-Jazeera correspondent reported that a Palestinian was killed by Israeli bullets at the Mazmoriya checkpoint, south of occupied Jerusalem. The occupation forces shot the young man at the military checkpoint between Jerusalem and Bethlehem, and the Israeli Broadcasting Corporation said that the perpetrator of the attack is a resident of Jabal Mukaber in Jerusalem. This operation comes at the height of a security alert in the occupied West Bank, including the city of Jerusalem, which witnessed more than one stabbing and shooting attack in the midst of the war on Gaza, which has been going on for about 3 months. The Ministry of Health in Gaza announced that the toll of the Israeli aggression on the Gaza Strip has risen to 21,320 martyrs, and 55,603 injured, in addition to massive destruction in residential neighborhoods, vital facilities and hospitals. Source : Al Jazeera + Agencies

author: Ben Davis
title: Dangerous Cold Temperatures Coming Minnesota, Iowa, South Dakota - NewsBreak
text:
[South Dakota](/south-dakota)
Dangerous Cold Temperatures Coming Minnesota, Iowa, South Dakota
By Ben Davis,
11 hours agoMinnesota, Iowa, and South Dakota are going to be seeing some of the coldest windchill temperatures so far this winter and some snow. According to the National Weather Service in Sioux Falls parts of Minnesota, Iowa, and South Dakota will be seeing some very cold temperatures with some accumulating snow.

author: Lucas Frau
title: Pizza Hut boycott due to Israel Instagram post. A look at why
text: Pizza Hut may be the latest franchise to face protests due the store's perceived support of Israel during the warfare currently happening in Gaza. Last week, Pizza Hut Israel's Instagram account reposted a photo from the user alex_shults which depicts two soldiers smiling and holding several pizza boxes in their hands. Quads News Network, a Palestinian youth news agency, took screenshots of the photo and posted it to X, formerly, known as Twitter. Boycotts: Why are people boycotting Starbucks? A look inside the scrutiny of the coffee chain Palestinian supporters are calling for consumers to boycott the pizza brand for their latest actions. The hashtag #boycottpizzahut has nearly half a million views on TikTok. On Pizza Hut's official Instagram page, the top comment on their latest post reads "We ordered pizza tonight and it WASN'T from you #freepalestine." Pizza Hut officials have not made a statement regarding their Israel Instagram account or about potential consumer boycotts. Pizza Hut joins the likes of Starbucks that have received backlash due to their stances on the conflict in the Middle East. Palestinian supporters began boycotting Starbucks due to statements made by the company that refused to acknowledge their union's support of Palestine amid the ongoing war between Israel and Hamas. Starbucks CEO, Laxman Narasimhan, released a public statement saying that the protests are stemming from a "misrepresentation on social media of what we stand for." He goes on to say that the coffee chain stands for humanity. Starbucks will release a quarterly report in February which may give light to observe if the boycotts have affected their sales in a significant way.

author: Eliana Silver
title: Donald Trump officials pinpoint moment Britons can expect US trade deal in boost for Brexit Britain
text:
GB News
A White House official said an agreement was expected in 'two weeks or maybe three'
Trending on GB News
White House officials believe a trade deal with Britain can be finalised within three weeks, sources have claimed.
An insider familiar with the strategy told The Telegraph that London was in a good position for a rapid deal.
However, the UK will likely be in a second wave of announcements, following Japan, India, and South Korea.
Donald Trump wants to reach agreements with these countries first in order to isolate China.
Britain was slapped with a blanket 10 per cent tariff on nearly all goods imported into the US after Trump's "liberation day" move to reset global trade
REUTERS
A White House official told The Telegraph that an agreement was expected "soon", saying: "Two weeks or maybe three."
It comes a day after JD Vance, the US Vice-President, sent the Ftse 100 surging by predicting that Trump would agree a "great" trade deal with London.
Vance cited Trump's "cultural affinity" with Britain as a key factor, telling Unherd: "There's a real cultural affinity."
"And of course, fundamentally America is an Anglo country... I think there's a good chance that, yes, we'll come to a great agreement that's in the best interest of both countries."
MORE LIKE THIS:
Vance added that they were "working very hard with Keir Starmer's Government".
Britain was slapped with a blanket 10 per cent tariff on nearly all goods imported into the US after Trump's "liberation day" move to reset global trade.
White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said there were already 15 trade deals on the table.
More than 75 countries have reached out to strike agreements before the end of a 90-day pause on more aggressive tariffs.
Trump officials have said Britain was in a good position for a fast deal because it imports more goods from the US than it exports.
However, they also caution that nothing can be taken for granted with Trump's unpredictable style.
Steve Bannon, Trump's former strategist, said a deal with the UK would be among the simplest and fastest to negotiate.
"You (Britain) don't make anything anymore," he said. "You don't make anything we're trying to bring back. That's why Japan and Korea will be tough."
More than 75 countries have reached out to strike agreements before the end of a 90-day pause on more aggressive tariffs
REUTERSHe added: "Sure you guys make automobiles but it is nothing in the grand scheme of things. They're kind of bespoke Jaguars and Aston Martins."
Trump met Japanese officials on Wednesday morning.
Chancellor Rachel Reeves is expected in Washington next week for the IMF's spring meetings.
Britain may have to wait for other deals to be finalised as the Trump administration tries to build a trade bloc against China's manufacturing might.
South Korea's finance minister is due to meet Trump's treasury secretary next week.
However, Britain comes with advantages that other nations cannot match, according to Vance, who noted that Britain and the US already enjoy a "reciprocal relationship".
A British Government spokesman said negotiations with the US remain ongoing.
